cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {W} or {U}.)[/i]
Glacial Floodplain enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“The villagers were nice to me, but Magnus had to hide or he'd spook them like last time.”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {U} or {B}.)[/i]
Ice Tunnel Enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“It's so spooky here... ECHO!”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {T}, Sacrifice Auroric Landscape: Search your library for a snow land with a basic land type, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Every time we pass by here, it somehow looks different from the last time.”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {B} or {R}.)[/i]
Sulfurous Mire enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Ach, no wonder magnus refused to come in here, it reeks!”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {R} or {G}.)[/i]
Highland Forest enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“The gremlins are so cute, and riding an aurochs is almost as comfy as riding magnus, almost.”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {G} or {W}.)[/i]
Arctic Treeline enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“These trees had so many crazy patterns, my head was spinning!”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {W} or {B}.)[/i]
Snowfield Sinkhole enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“It was so deep... neither of us could see the bottom.”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {B} or {G}.)[/i]
Woodland Chasm enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“It looked pretty at a glance, but Magnus was really uneasy so we didn't stick around for long.”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {G} or {U}.)[/i]
Rimewood Falls enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I wish these weren't so vertical, they look so fun to sled down.”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {U} or {R}.)[/i]
Volatile Fjord enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“One moment the water is calm, the next it's frozen entirely!”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {R} or {W}.)[/i]
Alpine Meadow enters tapped.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I thought I saw something look at me from behind the trees, but Magnus didn't smell anything.”
 —Ari's Travel Notes.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Equipment you control not attached to a creature are 3/2 vehicle artifacts with menace and crew 1.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I was never one to wear armor. One thing led to another and here we are!”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Menace
Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice one of them. If you do, untap all creatures you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

At the beginning of combat on your turn, forge +1/+0. [i](Create an Equipment artifact token with equip {2} and “Equipped creature has +1/+0.”)[/i]
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, you may attach each equipment you control to it.
Blazing Retribution deals X damage to any target. You may discard up to X cards. If you do, draw that many cards.

You don't lose unspent green mana as steps and phases end.
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Cojocar Huntress this turn dies, add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Out of her element, yet she remains just as deadly as she did in Ardyal.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever Nanna, Small but Mighty becomes tapped, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Then if there are five or more +1/+1 counters among creatures you control, Nanna, Small but Mighty invokes. [i](Cast a copy of this creature's Skill without paying its mana cost.)[/i]
cards.rules_text2: Draw a card for each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it. Those creatures gain indestructible until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text2: [i]“I'll never refuse a challenge!”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Epitome [i](If there are eight or more mana abilities among permanents you control, you become enlightened for the rest of the game.)[/i]
Wildform Reclaimer gets +4/+4 as long as you're enlightened.
{T}, Sacrifice a permanent: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. Put a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the amount of {S} spent to cast this spell.

Other Shamans you control get +1/+1.
Whenever one or more Shaman creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Fast enough to get the word of danger spread quickly.[/i]

Convoke
Trample, haste
You may cast Overgrown Steelsheell from your graveyard. You can't spend mana to cast Overgrown Steelsheell this way.

Adaptive Scavenger has hexproof from each card type among exiled cards.
{1}: Exile target card from a graveyard. Put a +1/+1 counter on Adaptive Scavenger if it has a type not found among cards exiled with Adaptive Scavenger.

As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a creature card that shares a type with the sacrificed creature, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle. Exile Spiritual Order.

Intrepidity is all colors.
Whenever a snow land you control enters, add one mana of any color.
Whenever you cast a snow creature spell, reveal the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of colors spent to cast it. You may put a snow noncreature card from among them into your hand, then shuffle.

Epitome [i](If there are eight or more mana abilities among permanents you control, you become enlightened for the rest of the game.)[/i]
Whenever you attack, look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield tapped and attacking if you're enlightened. If you don't, put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

Trample
Whenever Skadi, Fierce Protectress or another Shaman you control enters you may pay {RG}. If you do, it fights up to one target creature you don't control.

Flying, haste
Whenever you forge, you may create a 1/1 white and red Dwarf Warrior creature token with lifelink and haste. If you do, attach that equipment to it.
Exile an instant or sorcery spell you control: Urdie, Inquisite Scholar invokes. Activate only once each turn. [i](Cast a copy of this creature's Skill without paying its mana cost.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text2: [i]“The trick is to make sure the soul is willing to lend a hand.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Convoke
Whenever Hodur, Varloch Elder enters or attacks, create an X/X Blue Goat Spirit creature token, where X is the number of tapped creatures you control.

If you would create one or more tokens, you may instead return Dritta, Shadewrought from your graveyard to the battlefield and put that many +1/+1 counters on it.
Counters remain on Dritta as it moves to any zone other than a player's hand or library.

Flying
When Malignatus, Prison-Breaker enters, you may discard your hand. If you do, draw three cards.
{B}{R}, Sacrifice two artifacts and/or creatures: Return Malignatus from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

At the beginning of combat on your turn, each opponent mills cards equal to the greatest power among Horror creatures you control. Then if a graveyard has thirteen or more cards in it, Rind, Head Priestess invokes. [i](Cast a copy of this creature's Skill without paying its mana cost.)[/i]
cards.rules_text2: For each opponent, put up to one target creature card from their graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. They become Horrors in addition to their other types.
